guide.introduction: With a few easy steps build a trip wire!
guide.introduction_rendered:
With a few easy steps build a trip wire!

Relevant parts
  • AA Battery Holder
  • AA Battery
  • Beeper/Buzzer
  • Cable
  • Copper pins
  • Photo frame hook
Tools
  • Scissors
  • Soldering/desoldering tools
  • Wire cutter/stripper

lines.text: Solder a wire to one terminal of a beeper or buzzer.
lines.text_raw: Solder a wire to one terminal of a beeper or buzzer.

lines.text: Put two pins or nails into a board.
lines.text_raw: Put two pins or nails into a board.

lines.text: Put in a third pin with a photo hook pivoting on it. Position the pin so that when the hook swings it will contact one of the other two pins.
lines.text_raw: Put in a third pin with a photo hook pivoting on it. Position the pin so that when the hook swings it will contact one of the other two pins.

lines.text: Solder the wire from the beeper/buzzer to the pin that the hook will touch.
lines.text_raw: Solder the wire from the beeper/buzzer to the pin that the hook will touch.

lines.text: Solder a wire from a battery pack to the hook.
lines.text_raw: Solder a wire from a battery pack to the hook.

lines.text: Complete the circuit by soldering a wire that connects the remaining terminals of the battery pack and the beeper/buzzer.
lines.text_raw: Complete the circuit by soldering a wire that connects the remaining terminals of the battery pack and the beeper/buzzer.

lines.text: Tie a string to the hook. Mount the board on one side of a doorway or walkway and stretch the string across to the other side.
lines.text_raw: Tie a string to the hook. Mount the board on one side of a doorway or walkway and stretch the string across to the other side.

lines.text: Now wait for someone to walk into your trap!
lines.text_raw: Now wait for someone to walk into your trap!

guide.summary: Make a trip wire that beeps when someone walks into it.
